business.headline: No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

Gold ETFs vs physical gold: What smart investors are looking at, explains expertGold may be timeless, but the way Indians invest in it is changing fast. With rising awareness of hidden costs, gold ETFs are gaining traction as a smarter, hassle-free alternative.

How Piyush Pandey made India fall in love with adsPiyush Pandey transformed Indian advertising with heartfelt stories and local flavour. His campaigns blended wit and emotion, leaving a lasting cultural impact.

Remembering Piyush Pandey: The ad legend who made brands immortalFor over four decades, the Jaipur-born storyteller reshaped Indian advertising, turning simple commercials into cultural phenomena and making brands like Fevicol, Cadbury, and Asian Paints inseparable from the Indian consciousness.​

CA explains why saving before spending works best for financial stabilityWhile most people save whatever is left after spending, CA Meenal Goel flips the approach. Her mantra, prioritise savings before expenses, has helped her stay financially secure and stress-free.

Error in your ITR filing? Here's how to correct it with an updated returnRealised there's an error in your ITR after submission? You're not alone. Many taxpayers make small mistakes while filing, but the good news is — you can still correct them through an updated return.

Why the world's central banks are buying gold like never beforeNot just households and investors, but central banks around the globe are buying gold like it's Dhanteras every day. So why are the world's biggest buyers going for bullion? Read on to find out.
Target announces 1,800 job cuts in a decade amid falling salesAll corporate employees in the US have been asked to work from home next week as the company finalises its restructuring process.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: Is the rally over and what should you do next?After a nine-week winning streak, gold and silver prices are finally losing steam as investors book profits amid a stronger dollar, easing global tensions, and anticipation over key US economic data.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as FMCG stocks offset metal gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 96.63 points to 84,459.77, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 24.20 points to 25,866.45 as of 9:28 am.

Midwest listing today: Will it give investors profit? See what GMP suggestsMidwest IPO was subscribed 92.36 times overall. The retail portion was booked 25.52 times, the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category saw 146.99 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category was subscribed 176.57 times.

Banks to allow up to 4 nominees per account from November 1. Here's how it helps youThe decision to allow four nominees aims to make the claim settlement process smoother, more transparent, and uniform across all banks in the country.

Gold, silver prices rebound amid volatility. Will they rise today?Following a rough start earlier this week, gold and silver staged a mild recovery on Thursday. While the recovery lifted market mood, the outlook for today depends on global data and investor sentiment.

Apple loses UK lawsuit over App Store's unfair 30% developer commissionsApple has been found guilty in a London court for abusing its dominant position by charging app developers an unfair 30 per cent commission on its App Store. The ruling marks a significant legal challenge against the tech giant's business practices in the UK market.

Dreamliner aircraft saw 31 faulty deployment of emergency turbine in 14 yearsBoeing's Dreamliner aircraft reported 31 instances of faulty deployment of Ram Air Turbine, which is deployed automatically in the eventuality of a dual engine failure or total electric or hydraulic failure.

entertainment.headline: Manish Malhotra teases Karan Johar for not giving credit, KJo jokes about paycheck Fashion designer Manish Malhotra accused filmmaker Karan Johar of not giving him credit for his work on JioHotstar's 'Pitch To Get Rich'. To which, KJo joked that Malhotra is well-compensated for his work.

Bill Gates x Tulsi Virani: The wild story behind most unexpected crossover on TV In a twist no one saw coming, 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' featured Bill Gates casually video-chatting with Tulsi Virani. The viral episode shows nostalgia and surprise as Tulsi's speech on motherhood and nutrition catches Gates' attention online.

Our prayer for protection: Sunjay Kapur's wife performs puja amid property dispute Late Sunjay Kapur's wife, Priya Sachdev, recently performed puja with son, Azarius and shared pictures from the auspicious occasion on social media. The puja came amid a dispute over Sunjay's property.

Amaal Mallik to leave Bigg Boss 19 house due to health concerns: Reports Singer Amaal Mallik is likely to leave the 'Bigg Boss 19' house due to health concerns. Reports suggest he could take a temporary exit soon. The latest post by his father, Daboo Malik, has added to the exit rumours.

Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan graduates from therapy, opens up about life ahead Ira Khan has "graduated" from eight years of therapy and shared her reflections on embracing life and mental health openly on Instagram.

Heartbroken Ila Arun shares pain over brother Piyush Pandey's death Actor-singer Ila Arun shared an emotional note to condole her brother Piyush Pandey's death. The advertising icon died at the age of 70.

Ayushmann Khurrana finds divine light in Thamma's success, remembers his father Ayushmann Khurrana shared an emotional note after the success of his Diwali release 'Thamma', which continues its box office run with over Rs 58 crore nett. Calling the film's success "a divine light," Khurrana expressed gratitude to his family, fans, and late father for their blessings.

Lokah Chapter 1 on OTT: When and where to watch Kalyani Priyadarshan's blockbuster After a record-breaking theatrical run, 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' lands on JioHotstar this October The Malayalam fantasy-action film stars Kalyani Priyadarshan as Malayalam cinema's first female superhero, blending mythology with modern flair.

Yash attends KGF cinematographer Bhuvan Gowda and Nikitha's wedding. Pics Actor Yash attended cinematographer Bhuvan Gowda's wedding to entrepreneur Nikitha. The event brought together notable Kannada film personalities.

Amitabh Bachchan mourns Piyush Pandey's death, calls him a creative genius Amitabh Bachchan expressed deep sorrow over the death of renowned adman Piyush Pandey. He called him 'a creative genius, a friend, a guide' in a moving tribute.

BB 19: Baseer Ali's mother calls his bond with Nehal Chudasama part of the game In Bigg Boss 19, Nehal Chudasama and Baseer Ali's growing closeness has raised eyebrows, but Baseer's mother insists it's just a game move, not real romance.

Vetri Maaran praises Dhruv, calls Bison striking meditation on resilience, resistance Director Vetri Maaran praised director Mari Selvaraj's 'Bison Kaalamaadan' and star Dhruv Vikram. The filmmaker highlighted the film's themes and visual storytelling. The film, based on Kabaddi player Manathi Ganesan, received critical acclaim and commercial success.

Dark fascination: The growing obsession of serial killers in films and web series The fascination with serial killer stories has grown globally, with films and web series exploring both real and fictional crimes. Audiences are drawn to these dark tales for their suspense, insight into human nature, and the thrill of seeing justice unfold.

Madhuri Dixit, Jackie Shroff's 100 Days set for web series remake | Exclusive Madhuri Dixit and Jackie Shroff's '100 Days' is set to be remade into a web series by its original producer, Jay Mehta.  The show will feature Abhishek Kumaarr and Srishti Singh in the lead.

Kim Kardashian reveals brain aneurysm, blames stress from marriage to Kanye West Kim Kardashian revealed she has been diagnosed with an unruptured brain aneurysm during a routine MRI, as shown in a new teaser for 'The Kardashians' Season 7. While doctors say she's not in immediate danger, Kardashian linked the health issue to years of emotional stress and her turbulent relationship with Kanye West.

Sachin Sanghvi of Sachin-Jigar duo accused of sexual harassment, released on bail Musician-composer Sachin Sanghvi of the Sachin-Jigar duo has been charged with alleged sexual harassment after a complaint by a 29-year-old. Sanghvi was arrested and later released on bail, with legal proceedings underway.

Actor Ken Karunaas's debut directorial begins, Karthi gives first clap Actor Ken Karunaas commenced his first film as director with a formal puja event. Industry figures including Vetri Maaran, Vishal, and Karthi attended the launch.

Shreyas Talpade, Alok Nath named in Uttar Pradesh investment fraud Bollywood actors Shreyas Talpade and Alok Nath have been named among 24 accused in a UP cooperative society fraud case that allegedly duped villagers with false investment promises. The Supreme Court has granted Talpade interim protection from arrest as the probe continues.

general news.headline: Maharashtra doctor dies by suicide, leaves note on palm accusing cop of rapeA doctor, who was allegedly raped multiple times by a police officer and mentally harassed by another individual for the past five months, died by suicide at a district hospital in Maharashtra.

He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.

After India, Taliban-ruled Afghanistan rushes to turn off Pak's tapAfter India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, Afghanistan is now moving to curb Pakistan's access to water from cross-border rivers. The Taliban's Supreme Leader has said that Kabul will build a dam on the Kunar river as soon as possible, just weeks after Afghanistan and Pakistan engaged in a war in which hundreds were killed.

Suicide over 'sex abuse'; accused engineer kills self, IAS officer named in FIRHours after the death of a 19-year-old boy, a suicide note alleging sexual abuse surfaced, accusing an IAS officer and a senior engineer in Arunachal Pradesh. Following the note, the Public Works Department engineer allegedly shot himself dead. The twin incidents have sent shockwaves across the state.

Bill Gates x Tulsi Virani: The wild story behind most unexpected crossover on TVIn a twist no one saw coming, 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' featured Bill Gates casually video-chatting with Tulsi Virani. The viral episode shows nostalgia and surprise as Tulsi's speech on motherhood and nutrition catches Gates' attention online.

China builds new air defence site near India border, satellite images revealSatellite imagery shows a new Chinese air-defence complex taking shape, comprising command and control buildings, barracks, vehicle sheds, munition storage, and radar positions. But the most intriguing feature of this facility, experts say, is a set of covered missile launch positions, believed to be equipped with retractable roofs for Transporter Erector Launcher vehicles that can carry, elevate, and fire missiles.

No plan B for Gaza: Marco Rubio calls Trump's plan best and only optionEarlier this month, Hamas released all 20 Israeli live hostages in two phases to the Red Cross as part of the new Gaza ceasefire agreement between Israel and the group.

PM endorses Nitish as Bihar Chief Minister amid Tejashwi's 'won't make him CM' attackIn a first, Prime Minister Narendra Modi endorsed Nitish Kumar as the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance's chief ministerial face, claiming that the alliance under his leadership would break all previous electoral records.

How treachery helped Pakistan grab India-Afghanistan Silk Route linkWhile Afghanistan and Pakistan were engaged in a war this month, an image showing an India-Afghanistan border pillar from the 1930s went viral. India and Afghanistan shared a small land border through the Wakhan Corridor before Pakistan wedged itself in through treachery and the illegal occupation of Gilgit-Baltistan in 1947.

Will speak to whomever needed: DK Shivakumar on Yathindra's leadership remarkKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar said he will speak to "whomever should be spoken to" amid leadership change talks. His statement came after Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah praised Satish Jarkiholi's progressive thinking.

Hundreds, including Indians, risk lives to flee Chinese mafia-run cybercrime hubAround 700 trafficked workers, including Indians, fled the Chinese mafia-run KK Park compound in Myanmar after the junta raided the facility. Many fleeing the cybercrime hub, risked their lives swimming across the Moei river into Thailand. Hundreds were detained by Thai authorities, while hundreds more, including Indians, remain trapped or in hiding in Myanmar.

Canada cheated and got caught: Trump slams Ottawa over tariffs, Ronald Reagan adThis comes after a Canadian political advertisement used an edited recording of Ronald Reagan criticising tariffs and warning they could trigger trade wars and economic hardship. Trump, branded the ad "fraudulent" and accused Ottawa of manipulating Reagan's words.

How Piyush Pandey made India fall in love with adsPiyush Pandey transformed Indian advertising with heartfelt stories and local flavour. His campaigns blended wit and emotion, leaving a lasting cultural impact.

26% MBA surge in India: Can we cash in on the opportunity amid visa woes abroad?GMAC data shows a 26% rise in MBA applications in India as visa uncertainty in the US, UK and Canada pushes students to domestic management programmes. This could be a big win for India or a missed opportunity. Policy, capacity, and quality will decide the outcome.

Cop's wife accuses IPS officer of harassment, he files extortion complaintLast week, the wife of a Chhattisgarh cop filed a complaint accusing an IPS officer of harassment. A day before the woman's complaint, the officer had filed a complaint against the woman, accusing her of blackmail and extortion.

Navy receives 'Mahe', first indigenous anti-submarine warship built in KochiMahe is the first of eight such Anti-Submarine Warfare Shallow Water Crafts that will join the Indian Navy's fleet in the coming years.

How Param Vir Subedar Joginder Singh stunned the Chinese at Bum La in 1962Param Vir Subedar Joginder Singh held his post at Bum La in 1962 with extraordinary courage, leading fierce counterattacks despite grievous injuries wounds. He was later captured by the Chinese and died in custody. The courageous martyr was posthumously awarded the Param Vir Chakra.

Smriti Irani's MacBook call with Microsoft's Bill Gates is the ultimate tech crossoverSmriti Irani was seen video calling Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates - not on a Windows laptop, but on an Apple MacBook, in a Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 episode.

Future of UK city's only Hindu temple in doubt as council plans site saleThe Bharat Hindu Samaj Mandir, founded in 1986 in the New England Complex of Peterborough, has for nearly four decades been at the heart of community life for Hindus in UK. The complex is now being placed for open sale.

30,000 people duped of Rs 1,500 crore, Bengaluru, Delhi worst hit: CentreInvestment scams have resulted in financial losses exceeding Rs 1,500 crore for over 30,000 people in India's top cities in the last six months. Bengaluru, Hyderabad, and Delhi-NCR account for the majority of impacted victims and financial damage.

Nobody Wants This 2 review: The modern-day therapy we didn't know we neededRelease Date:Thu Oct 23, 2025'Nobody Wants This' on Netflix explores modern love, communication, and family, bringing together heart and relatability in a must-watch series. Season 2 of the hit show premiered on October 23.

If she's a 10, you're an asset: Elon Musk on 'sex warfare' in Silicon ValleyThe Times reported that attractive Chinese and Russian spies are infiltrating US tech companies by seducing employees to steal trade secrets. Tech magnate Elon Musk reacted to the report in his usual memelord style.

Teen dies after boys fire crackers from iron pipe, hits her head on impactAccording to the FIR, three boys were bursting firecrackers by stuffing them into an iron pipe and placing it between stones. During the process, the pipe fell, and as the firecracker exploded, it shot the pipe at high speed towards Hena, who was standing nearby. The impact caused her fatal head injury.

sports.headline: Kane Williamson breaks silence on New Zealand future: I still love the game Ahead of his return to international cricket in the upcoming ODIs against England, veteran New Zealand batter Kane Williamson said that discussions about his availability for the rest of the home summer are still ongoing.

3rd ODI: Virat Kohli faces another Sydney test. Will it end like the last one? Australia vs India, 3rd ODI: 10 months after his Test career ended in Sydney, Virat Kohli returns to the same venue facing another stern examination — this time in one-day colours. With back-to-back ducks and mounting scrutiny, the third ODI against Australia could define how the next chapter of his white-ball career unfolds, as India fight to avoid a clean sweep.

Tom Aspinall aims for undisputed heavyweight glory at UFC 321 against Ciryl Gane England's Tom Aspinall prepares to defend his UFC heavyweight championship against Ciryl Gane, focusing on a strategic approach amidst the unpredictability of the division.

Alexander Isak likely to miss Liverpool's clash against Brentford: Arne Slot Liverpool could be without the services of Alexander Isak for the clash against Brentford. Isak suffered a groin injury during the clash against Eintracht Frankfurt in the Champions League.

Sarfaraz Khan doesn't need India A to play international cricket: Shardul Thakur Mumbai captain Shardul Thakur has backed Sarfaraz Khan, saying he does not need India A matches to stake a claim for the national Test side. Thakur pointed to Sarfaraz's strong domestic record and ability to perform under pressure as proof of his readiness.

Alyssa Healy to return vs South Africa? Tahlia McGrath updates on Australia skipper Alyssa Healy, who missed Australia's last Women's World Cup game against England due to a minor calf injury, returned to training on Friday, with her participation against South Africa on October 24 still to be confirmed.

Virat Kohli has to find form quickly, competition for places is high: Ravi Shastri Ravi Shastri has said that Virat Kohli needs to find form quickly as the competition for places is high at the moment in the Indian ODI team. Kohli suffered twin failures in the first two games of the series.

Angry Virat Kohli fans flood Xavier Bartlett's Insta after Adelaide duck Australian fast bowler Xavier Bartlett paid the price of dismissing India star Virat Kohli for a duck, becoming the latest target of emotionally charged fans following the second ODI at the Adelaide Oval.

Serena Williams backs Carlos Alcaraz to break Novak Djokovic's Grand Slam recordSerena Williams, the 23-time Grand Slam singles champion, has backed Spain's Carlos Alcaraz to one day match or even surpass Novak Djokovic's record haul of 24 men's Grand Slam titles.

Elena Rybakina storms into third successive WTA Finals with semis spotKazakhstan's Elena Rybakina secured her third straight WTA Finals berth after defeating Canada's Victoria Mboko 6-3, 7-6(4) to reach the Pan Pacific Open semi-finals in Tokyo. Rybakina will next face Czech youngster Linda Noskova in the series.

Marcus Rashford keen on making Barcelona move permanent after strong startMarcus Rashford hopes that FC Barcelona can extend his deal with the club to a permanent one after enjoying a brilliant start to their campaign.

Play Kuldeep, go with a batter short: Ex-India pacer's advice to Gambhir for 3rd ODIVarun Aaron has asked India to go with a batter short in the third ODI and play Kuldeep Yadav in the game in Sydney. Kuldeep is yet to play a match in the series.

Virat Kohli needs to learn from Shreyas Iyer, play India A games to find form: KaifMohammed Kaif suggests Virat Kohli needs more game time to regain form after a tough ODI return. Kohli aims to bounce back in the final match against Australia and secure his place ahead of the 2027 World Cup.

Hope Virat Kohli scores in Sydney: Ashwin fears blame game if batter fails againIndia tour of Australia: Virat Kohli has failed to trouble the scorers on his return to international cricket. The former captain will be under immense pressure as India face Australia in the series final in Sydney on Saturday, October 25.

India keep Kuldeep Yadav in deck as Australia use Adam Zampa as trump card in AdelaideIn what was a game of poker in Adelaide, India decided to keep their trump card, Kuldeep Yadav, in the deck while Australia used their ace, Adam Zampa, to get the win. India missed a trick with the spinner, who could have been a mystery for the Aussies.

Calmness and clarity: What makes Smriti Mandhana, Pratika Rawal combination click?Former cricketer Anjum Chopra praises India's opening pair Mandhana and Rawal for their complementary styles. Their partnership played a crucial role in securing India's semifinal spot, raising hopes for a strong knockout performance.

From backyard dreams to World Cup 100: Pradeep Rawal on daughter Pratika's big momentWomen's World Cup: India Speaking exclusively to India Today, Pradeep Rawal shared how his daughter Pratika's World Cup century felt like a dream come true. He recalled their countless backyard sessions that laid the foundation for her big moment.

AUS vs IND: Glenn Maxwell returns from injury as Australia revise T20I squadIndia tour of Australia: All-rounder Glenn Maxwell will return to competitive action for the first time since September. He has been added to the Australian T20I squad for the last three matches of a five-match series, starting October 28.

Watch: PSL team owner tears legal notice from Pakistan cricket body in live videoMultan Sultans co-owner Ali Khan Tareen has responded to the PCB's legal notice in a viral video, refusing to retract his criticism of PSL management. Tareen accused the board of mismanagement and a lack of openness to dialogue, as tensions rise between the franchise and league organisers.

Aaj farewell match tha: Rohit Sharma reacts to Gambhir's joke after Adelaide 73AUS vs IND: India coach Gautam Gambhir's playful farewell joke brought a smile to Rohit Sharma after his gritty 73 in Adelaide. The light-hearted moment came amid fan speculation over the 38-year-old's ODI future.

Dad saw the spark at 3, Pratika Rawal lights up the World Cup 22 years laterPratika Rawal etched her name in the history books with her maiden century in the Women's World Cup against New Zealand in Navi Mumbai. After the match, her father, Pradeep Rawal, spoke to IndiaToday.in, recalling his daughter's journey to international cricket and addressing critics of her strike rate.

Smriti Mandhana is outstanding, glad I don't have to deal with her: Sophie DevineWomen's World Cup: Sophie Devine said she is relieved to retire without facing Smriti Mandhana again, praising the Indian batter's record-breaking form and noting that she will continue to improve.

How Colombo rain ruined Sophie Devine's farewell Women's World Cup campaignSophie Devine's farewell World Cup ended in frustration as New Zealand fell 53 runs short against India, officially knocking the White Ferns out. Part poor form, part Colombo's merciless rain, the campaign was sabotaged by abandoned matches against Pakistan and Sri Lanka, leaving points shared and hopes dashed.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
